div.p: Principal Librarian of the public Library,

Allow me, dear Dr Bride, to submit to you herewith a letter, received to day by the French mail, by which letter the Publishing Establishment of Th. Fischer in Cassel offers according to byefollowing Index
M's letter is accompanied by a letter to him from T. Fischer, 14 February 1882 (1883?) (in this edition as 82-02-14a), and a handwritten list of publications and prices. to supply additions to the series of works, acquired by the trustees of the public Library through purchase from the Cassel establishment after the International Exhibition of Melbourne.
International Exhibition, Melbourne, 1880-1. See M to M. Irving, 27 March 1881; H. Sheffield to M, 6 April 1881 (in this edition as 81-04-06a); and R. Curtis to M, 13 April 1881. I have no doubt, that — if a somewhat extensive order was given — a considerable reduction in the prices would be made.

This is however the whole correspondence I have on this subject, beyond an incidental expression in one of Mr Fischer's letters to me, that he could furnish considerable addenda to the important works, which the public Library already secured from his issues.
See also M to T. Bride, 9 May 1883 (in this edition as 83-05-09a); T. Bride to M, 29 August 1883 (in this edition as 83-08-29a); M to T. Bride, 30 August 1883; and T. Bride to M, 26 September 1883 (in this edition as 83-09-26a).

I avail myself of this opportunity of thanking you for your Kindness of allowing me on several recent occasions the loan of Books for my studies for some days from your grand establishment. Let me add, that I could offer for your acceptance still 25 or 50 copies of the index to L. sp. pl. first edition,
i.e. M's index to Linnaeus's Species plantarum (B80.04.04). if you have any use for this little publication while interchanges between your and other institutions are going on. The first part of the Census of Australian plants
B83.03.04. has also recently appeared, so that doubtless the Victorian Government will place the usual 25 copies at your disposal, and so it will be likely in the Mines Department, where the second decade of the Veg. fossils
B82.11.04. is just got ready
